summary: An email from an Assistant United States Attorney to attorney Gloria Allred, notifying her of a court conference scheduled by Judge Berman regarding the dismissal of the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein following his death. The email informs that victims may be heard and offers travel assistance for victims who wish to attend.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein

connections.description: The AUSA is communicating with Allred, an attorney representing victims, about a court proceeding.
Allred's clients (victims) are being given the opportunity to be heard in Judge Berman's court.
Judge Berman is presiding over the legal proceedings related to the dismissal of the indictment against Epstein.

events.title: Court Conference on Dismissal of Epstein Indictment
events.description: Judge Berman has scheduled a conference regarding the dismissal of the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein in light of his death. Victims are allowed to be heard.

events.title: Email Notification Sent
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney emails Gloria Allred to inform her of the upcoming court conference and offer travel assistance for victims.

keyFacts: A court conference was scheduled for August 27, 2019, to address the dismissal of the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein following his death.
Judge Berman indicated that victims would be allowed to be heard during the proceeding, either directly or through counsel.
The prosecution offered to provide travel assistance for victims represented by Gloria Allred who wished to attend the conference but could not afford travel costs.
The email demonstrates ongoing legal procedures and consideration for victim participation even after Epstein's death.
